name: disunion
content:
disunion noun [U]
(DISAGREEMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a situation in which people disagree so much that they can no longer work or exist together in an effective way: Differences in language can sometimes cause disunion between countries. The team succeeded in producing a state of nervous disunion in their opponents. Synonym
disunity
More examplesFewer examplesThere was no disunion among the forces, which made the army more powerful.The Prime Minister is risking disunion in her party with these actions.If his goal was to create disunion, misunderstanding and confusion, he has succeeded.

disunion noun [U]
(SEPARATION)
the action or state of separating: The argument in favour of disunion was not presented honestly. For the UK, disunion from Scotland would mean losing five million citizens. Related word
